As reported on February 25, 2020, in Abrego, Norte de Santander department, soldiers and police officers seized 891 kilos of cocaine and 968 gallons of liquid used to manufacture cocaine. The drug belongs to Los Pelusos gang (EPL). No arrests were made.
As reported on February 25, 2020, near Saravena, Arauca department, unidentified armed individuals activated explosives near a Colombian Army facility. No fatalities or injuries were reported.

notes: As reported on February 25, 2020, in the La Mina community, Naya, Valle del Cauca, a group of soldiers attacked and mistreated members of the community council of Rio Naya. Soldiers taped a video where the victims were saying that they have received good treatment by soldiers who are in the area. No further information.

As reported on February 25, 2020, in Campamento, Antioquia department, a farmer leader disappeared. His body was found on February 29. On December 18 2019, in front of the clinic Nuestra in Ibague, Tolima, health workers gathered to demand the payment of their salaries. [size=no report]

Between November 19 and 22 2019, the government of Colombia in Bogota, shut down all the borders. On 6 October 2019, in Medellin (Antioquia), a riot started between prisoners at the old police station in the neighbourhood of Santander, commune 6. The incident took place after a group of inmates extorted other prisoners, leading to a fight against each-other. Officials prevented the situation from escalating. 15 inmates were injured, mostly stabbed. [size=no report]

On 6 October 2019, in Cartagena (Bolivar), demonstrators marched through the streets of the city in protest against former President Uribe's (Democratic Center) court hearing for corruption and procedural fraud. [size=no report]

On 6 October 2019, in Medellin (Antioquia), demonstrators marched through the streets of the city in protest against former President Uribe's (Democratic Center) court hearing for corruption and procedural fraud. [size=no report]

On 6 October 2019, in Barranquilla (Atlantico), demonstrators marched through the streets of the city in protest against former President Uribe's (Democratic Center) court hearing for corruption and procedural fraud. [size=no report]
On 6 October 2019, in Medellin (Antioquia), around 200 people engaged in peaceful demonstration in support of animal rights. [size=around 200]

On October 05 2019, in the Viallabel sector, Floridablanca, Santander, a man, owner of a mechanical workshop, was attacked by several armed individuals aboard a motorcycle. The man was killed and the perpetrators fled. Police officers managed to arrest three individuals involved in the murder. The motives of the attack are unknown.

On October 4, 2019, in the rural area of Toribio, Cauca department, an indigenous artist was killed by unidentified suspects. After the attack, several pamphlets were distributed in the area with intimidating messages, which authorship is vested in Sinaloa Cartel, a Mexican drug-trafficking group that has intensified its presence in cocaine-producing areas in Colombia. No arrests were reported. One fatality recorded.

assoc_actor_2: Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia
notes: On 4 October 2019, in Iscuande (Narino), a former FARC dissident was killed by gunmen aboard a motorcycle. The reasons behind the crime were unknown, and there were no arrests reported.

On October 04 2019, at the Universidad Distrital, Bogota D.C, students protested to reject acts of corruption within the institution. It is reported that the vehicular passage was obstructed. [size=no report]
On October 04 2019, at the Rafael Calvo Maternity Hospital, Cartagena, health workers protested to demand the payment of their salaries owed to them for four months. [size=no report]

On October 04 2019, in the direction of Aguasclaras airport, Ocana municipality, North of Santander, a caravan of military vehicles was attacked with a remote explosive. It is reported that an armed group activated the explosive. No injuries or deaths are reported. The identity of the armed group is unknown.

On 4 Octobre 2019, in Alto Baudo area, Choco, there were reports of clashes between the ELN and armed groups. One person was reported killed by ELN members. Around 159 persons (47 families) from the Afro-Colombian communities of the rural areas of Amparrado and Cocalito in Alto Baudo were displaced and moved to Pie de Pato area.

On October 04 2019, at the Rumichaca International Bridge, Ipiales, Narino, police officers closed the border with Ecuador. The reason for the closure of the border is due to the protests that have been generated in Ecuador against the economic measures of President Lenin Moreno. It is reported that the closure has been intermittent.

On October 03 2019, in the village of Huasano, Corinto municipality, the bodies of two indigenous men were found. The two indigenous men were killed and their bodies presented signs of torture. It is reported that in recent weeks, several indigenous people have been killed in two regions of El Cauca.

On October 02 2019, in the Miraflores neighborhood, Cali, a university student was kidnapped by two armed men. It is reported that the student was in a car in the company of three friends. On October 04, the student's body was found with burns and gunshot wounds. The reasons for the attack are unknown.

On October 03 2019, on the campus of the University of Antioquia, Barranquilla, students from several universities entered to protest. It is reported that several activities were canceled and university staff was evacuated. The reason for the protest was not reported. [size=no report]

On October 03 2019, in the municipality Planeta Rica, Cordoba, 225 kilos of amphora, a high-powered explosive, were seized inside a bus. It is reported that legally, this explosive is used in mining works. It is illegally used to attack civilians and security forces. The destination of this explosive was San Juan de Uraba, Antioquia. One person was arrested.

On October 03 2019, at the District University, Macarena headquarters, in Bogota D.C, police officers fought against a student protest. It is reported that police officers fired tear gas. Two students from a nearby school are reported to have fainted due to the effects of tear gas. The students were demanding promptness in the investigations of corruption in the institution. [size=no report]

On October 02 2019, on Avenida Ambala, Ibague, Tolima, dozens of citizens protested to reject the construction of a bike track of 3.6 km long. Protesters reported that this construction was not consulted with citizens. [size=dozens]

actor1: FARC Dissident - 18th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (18th Front)
notes: As reported on 2 October 2019, in Briceno (Antioquia), an armed clash took place between the Colombian Army troops and FARC dissidents of the 18th Front. Dissidents were holding a meeting in the community of El Palmichal when officials arrived and started the shoot-out. Two of the five FARC members in the reunion were minors, who were taken by the authorities. Two dissidents were dead, and a civilian was injured.

As reported on 2 October 2019, in Barranquilla (Atlantico), residents of the neighbourhoods of Ciudadela 20 de Julio, Galan and Boston, engaged in demonstrations in different parts of the city to protest against the absence of electrity in the said areas. During the protests, roads were blocked and led to traffic congestions. [size=no report]

As reported on 2 October 2019, in Carraipia (La Guajira), an Wayuu man was shot to death by unidentified suspects, who were also Wayuu. The reasons behind the crime were unknown, and no arrests were reported.

As reported on 2 October 2019, in the rural area of Cucuta (Norte De Santander), two corpses were found with shots and signs of violence, inside black plastic bags, near the Venezuelan border. Neither the identity of the perpetrators nor the reasons behind the crime were known. The area is known for the disputes over the domain of smuggling routes and extortions with irregular crossings.

On October 02 2019, in the Rafael Calvo Maternity Hospital, Cartagena, health workers protested to demand the payment of their salaries and better working conditions. It has been reported that they have not been given uniforms for three years and have not been paid salaries for four months. [size=no report]

On 2 October 2019, in Teorama (Norte De Santander), a shoot-out took place between the Police Forces and an armed group when the latter perpetrated an attack against a police station in the city. The National Police, together with the Military Forces, started a counter operation to stop the shoot-out and to chase the suspects by land and air. One official was injured and taken to the hospital by helicopter. No arrests were reported.

On 2 October 2019, in Teorama (Norte de Santander), a shoot-out took place between Police officials and National Liberation Army (ELN) members after the latter attacked a Police station in the municipality. An official was severely injured, and there were no arrests reported.
On 1 October 2019, on the road between Covenas and Tolu, indigenous citizens engaged in protest against the establishment of a tolling area on the said road. [size=no report]

On October 01 2019, in La Parada, Cucuta, truck drivers and the police clashed after an incident (not specified) involving a man trading goods at the border. A car was burned and police officers fired tear gas. A pregnant woman had to be helped. [size=no report]
On 1 October 2019, in Talaga (Cauca), a corpse of an indigenous community leader was found. According to officials, he was shot to death by unidentified perpetrators. No arrests were reported.

On 1 October 2019, in Cucuta (Norte De Santander), a Venezuelan street vendor was shot to death by unidentified suspects in the neighbourhood of Cerro Norte. The reasons behind the crime were unknown, and there were no arrests reported.

On 30 September 2019, in Las Guacas (Cauca), an armed clash took place between unidentified armed groups. Neither the identity of the perpetrators nor the motives behind the shoot-out were known. No injuries or fatalities were reported. No arrests were reported either.

On 30 October 2019, in Toribio (Cauca), a civilian was shot to death by unidentified suspects, who assaulted him from a motorbike. The victim was an indigenous man, founder of the Indigenous Association "Avelino UI", and also member of other socio-political groups in the region. No arrests were reported.

On September 30 2019, in Buenos Aires, Cauca, an indigenous leader was kidnapped by an armed man. It is reported that the victim was tortured by five people. Supposedly, the victim was kidnapped due to a kidnapping that happened in previous days. The victim was left tied on a pole alive.

As reported on 30 September 2019, in Tiquisio Nuevo (Bolivar), family members and students gathered in front of the municipality hall to protest over remodelation work of the high school facilities, which were in an advanced state of decay. [size=no report]

On September 30 2019, at the Universidad del Atlantico, Barranquilla, students protested due to corruption within the institution and sexual harassment practices by the rector of the University. It is reported that protests will take place in several cities in the country. [size=no report]

On September 30, 2019, in La Caucana, in Tarazas jurisdiction, Antioquia department, unidentified armed men started shooting against civilians at a club. Three men were killed and another six were injured. According to police reports, the victims were coca-growers and members of the voluntary crop substitution project. In the territories of this location were known for being in dispute between Clan del Golfo and Los Caparros. No arrests were reported. 3 fatalities recorded.
On 30 September 2019, in Taraza (Antioquia), members of human rights organizations engaged in protest against the recent killings of two civilians that had taken place in the city. [size=no report]

On 28 September 2019, in the rural area of Tibu, Norte de Santander department, a military unit was ambushed with explosives devices. Sources claimed ELN forces perpetrated the attack, which killed two soldiers, and three more injured.

As reported on September 27 2019, in Sardinata, north of Santander, a Popular Liberation Army (EPL) leader was killed by military and police officers. On 27 September 2019, in Bogota, nearly 5,000 students marched through the streets of the city in a protest against police brutality and recent events of corruption registered in a public university in the country. [size=nearly 5,000]
As reported on 27 September 2019, in Cali, Valle Del Cauca, citizens protested against the water disruption in their neighborhood. [size=no report]

notes: On 17 March 2019, in La Guayacana, Narino, a social leader and JAC member was shot dead inside his house. His mother and his wife were also injured. The victim had previously received threats linked to his work in the crop substitution program.

On March 17, 2019, a vessel of the military forces of Colombia with four soldiers and one civilian on board disappeared in the shores of Buenaventura in Valle del Cauca. The remains of two of the soldiers were found on March 26, 2019, near Punta Soldado. The marina confirmed that the men were attacked presumably by ELN forces. The location of two of the soldiers and civilians remain unknown.

On March 17, media informed that indigenous groups of the area of Huila department blocked the road that connected the Neiva and Florencia, near the municipality of Hobo in Huila. The protest is peaceful. [size=no report]

In the week of March 16, 2019, military forces of Colombia clashed with the EPL in the area of Las Mercedes, municipality of Sardinata in Norte de Santander. Four EPL fighters died in the confrontation, while two more were captured by state forces.

March 16, 2019. In Teorama, Norte de Santander, ELN attacked the petrol pipeline with a low power explosive. The remnants of petrol split to Catatumbo river. The Military Forces of Colombia are working to secure the area and let Colombian Petrol Company ECOPETROL to repair the pipeline.

March 16, 2019. In Cajibio, Cauca, indigenous groups that blocked the Pan-American road in a protest were attacked by the Police in their camping sites of El Cairo and El Tunel. The protesters said the Police Forces attacked without provocation. The protesters have blocked the Pan-American Road in various locations, from Santander de Quilichao to Caldono. [size=large group]

source: General Command of the Military Forces - Colombia
notes: In the week of March 16, 2019, the military forces of Colombia destroyed drug production facilities that belonged to the ELN. The compound was located in the rural area of the municipality of Ocana in Norte de Santander.

March 16, 2019. In Cajibio, Cauca, a vehicle of the Ombudsman's Office was attacked by unidentified men with a low power explosive device. The explosive was thrown at the car by demonstrators that are blocking the Pan-American road since march 10. No injuries were reported. The Ombudsman's Office suspended their activities of verification and monitoring until the protesters guarantee the security of the personnel.

March 15, 2019. In Bogota D.C., young demonstrators joined the world march against climate change. Demonstrators met in different parts of the city, especially in Plaza de Bolivar, La Candelaria. [size=hundreds]

On March 15, 2019, during the indigenous protests taking place in the area of El Cairo, municipality of Cajibio in Cauca, a commission of the ombudsman office monitoring the demonstrators was attacked by unidentified men with an explosive device. No person resulted injured, device suspected to be a crude bomb [size=no report].
March 15, 2019. In Medellin, Antioquia, young protesters joined the world march against climate change. Protesters met at the Plaza de Las Luces. [size=no report]

In March 2019, militaries announced that two dissidents were killed during armed clashes in the area of Tumaco, Narino. Witnesses claim that soldiers attacked the house of the victims during the evening and shot the unarmed men, contradicting the military's version. The case is reported as a potential boosting of army statistics in the war against illegal armed organizations.
March 15, 2019. In Florencia, Caqueta, young protesters joined the world march against climate change. Protesters met in Plaza Santander. [size=no report]

March 15, 2019. In Acandi, Choco, protesters are blocking the flow of migrants. The protesters ask for the national and local governments to take care of the migrants and the public services of the population, especially water. More than 120 Cubans are blocked and need to leave the country before their temporary permits expire, otherwise they can be deported to Cuba. [size=no report]

March 15, 2019. In Saravena, Arauca, leader of ELN in the region surrender to the Police. He was chief of finances of the ELN in that region of the country, and face charges of homicide, conspiracy, kidnapping, rebellion and use of forbidden war methods.

March 15, 2019. In Cajibio, Cauca, a vehicle of the Ombudsman's Office was attacked by unidentified men with a low power explosive device. The Ombudsman's Office suspended their activities of verification and monitoring until the demonstrators guarantee the security of the personnel.

March 15, 2019. In Santander de Quilichao, Cauca, several indigenous groups blocked the Pan-American road in a protest. The protesters claimed that the National Government has not complied with the agreements reached with the previous government, and are also protesting due to the precarious security situation of the social leaders. For the second time since the protest began, the Police Forces of Colombia used the force to disperse the protest, with no positive results. [size=large group]

March 14, 2019. In the area between Carmen del Darien, Riosucio and Bojaya, armed clashes between National Liberation Army ELN and AGC (Clan del Golfo) maintain the population confined. Eight children have died since January 19, due to lack of food and medicines. At least 5.000 people are confined and uncommunicated. The population claim for the protection of the State through the army, but the military have not arrived in the area.

March 14, 2019. In rural area of Arauquita, Arauca, unidentified armed men detonated an explosive devise in the pipeline Cano Limon - Covenas. The Colombian Petrol Company EOPETROL said this is the ninth time the pipeline has been attacked during this year. The oil split covered an area of 1.250 square meters.

March 14, 2019. In Mocoa, Putumayo, indigenous people accompanied by members of black communities and peasants blocked the road that connects with Pitalito, Huila. The protesters ask for the regional and national governments to respect the peace agreements, the Special Peace Jurisdiction JEP, to continue talks with ELN, to stop mining in Putumayo and not to use glyphosate to combat illegal crops. the protesters ask for the presence of representatives of the national, regional and local governments. [size=no report]

March 14, 2019. It is the 18th attempt against the works in the 17 km road that the military forces prevent. The device was installed in a vehicle and had 210 kilograms of explosives.

March 14, 2019. In Hobo, Huila, people from Nasa, Misak, Yanacuna, Embera and Pijao indigenous groups blocked the 45 National Road in a protest. The protesters ask for respect for life and for the government to comply with the agreements reached with the previous government. This movement is linked to the protests in Cauca led by indigenous communities. At the end of the day the protesters reached some agreements with the local authorities and unblocked the road during some hours. [size=no report]

March 12, 2019. In Tierralta, Cordoba, Francia Elena Reyes Mendoza alias "La Sabrosa" surrendered to the Police. Reyes Mendoza was one of the most wanted criminals in the country and is an important member of AGC (Clan del Golfo) illegal armed group. The woman faces charges of homicide, conspiracy, fabrication, traffic and illegal carrying of weapons and ammunition.

March 12, 2019. In San Calixto, Norte de Santander, constant combats, mining camps and UXO have confined more than 2.000 people in 23 districts of the municipality. Landmines and UXO are located nearby roads and paths, crops, schools and water sources.

March 11, 2019. In rural area of Caceres, Antioquia, Military forces of Colombia in collaboration with Police Forces, confiscated illegal mining equipment valued in more than 1 million USD. The authorities confiscated 47 productive units, 50 motors, 10 dredgers and 2 excavators. The money produced by this activity finances illegal groups operating in the area: Clan del Golfo (AGC), Los Caparrapos and ELN. The operation took place in the wider region of Bajo Cauca, including the municipalities of Caceres, El Bagre, Nechi and Taraza.

March 11, 2019. In rural area of El Bagre, Antioquia, Military forces of Colombia in collaboration with Police Forces, confiscated illegal mining equipment valued in more than 1 million USD. The money produced by this activity finances illegal groups operating in the area: Clan del Golfo, Los Caparrapos and ELN. Within the framework of the indigenous demonstrations that started on March 10, 2019, and has last over two weeks, media reported that members of the Colombian police- ESMAD- attacked and destroyed the installation and the belongings of a group of 150 indigenous and protesters in the area of El Cairo in the municipality of Cajibio in Cauca. This area corresponds to one of the five different points of concentrations. Nearly 20 people have been reported injured during the time that the demonstration has lasted.

source: Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz

Armed men attacked a social leader and women rights activist on January 14th in the municipality of Agua Clara in Tumaco. No group has claimed this event yet. She died in the hospital of Pasto in Nari on January 24th.

Rioters in the municipality of Luruaco in Atlantico attacked two people suspected to killed a local farmer on January 14th. One person died and the other was severely injured. After the police intervened, one more person died allegedly by a police gunshot.

On the evening of January 13th armed men attacked a social leader of the Nasa community in the area of Tacueyo, municipality of Toribio. The victim survived the attack after local authorities arrived in the area. No group has claimed this event.

Armed men attacked the member of the JAC of the area Ciudadela Bonanza in Turbaco Bolivar, Manuel Echeverri on January 13th. The victim survived the attack. Later the police captured the perpetrators.

The facilities of an organization focus on human rights and defense of the social leaders were destroyed on January 11th. According to a press release of the organization, the attack is carried to due to their work in the country and not as a common crime.

actor2: FARC Dissident - 29th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (29th Front - Gonzalez Prado)
notes: On January 12th, the police forces of captures a commander of a FARC dissident groups in the rural area of Salahonda in Narino.

A nationwide protest took place on January 11th, in the main cities of Colombia to demand the resignation of the Attorney General of Colombia Nestor Humberto Martinez. Martinez has been accused of corruption. The protests were in several cities including Bucaramanga, Santander

On 11 Jan 2019, on the road that connects Palmira with Pradera in Valle del Cauca, the truck in which the female leader and member of the victims of the "false positive case" was shot three times by armed men in a motorcycle. Moments before she had received a death threat call. Castillo is a primary witness against the military forces of Colombia. She was reported uninjured.

A nationwide protest took place on January 11th, in the main cities of Colombia to demand the resignation of the Attorney General of Colombia Nestor Humberto Martinez. Martinez has been accused of corruption. The protests were in several cities including Armenia in Quindio.

A nationwide protest took place on January 11th, in the main cities of Colombia to demand the resignation of the Attorney General of Colombia Nestor Humberto Martinez. Martinez has been accused of corruption. The protests were in several cities including Pasto, Narino

A private helicopter of a company was attacked by EPL members in the municipality of Hacari in Norte de Santander on January 11th. The pilot had an emergency land after they were shot. Then armed men arrived in the area of landing in San Jose del Tarra, Hacari and stole a high amount of money behind transported. The family denounced three crew members that were in the helicopter disappeared after the attack and it is believed that were kidnapped by the armed group. The EPL and the ELN attributed separately the attack. Nevertheless, the ELN has confirmed that they have the flight crew.

The military forces of Colombia increase the military personnel in the area El Salado in the municipality of Carmen del Bolivar in Bolivar on January 11th. This decision was taken after several denounces of social leaders of threats against the civil population of this town.

On January 11 2019, the remains of four adult men were found near a public park in the municipality of Jamundi. According to local witnesses, the perpetrator was the EPL. However, authorities did not confirm this version.

On January 10th, a man was executed by unidentified armed men in the area Potrero Grande in the municipality of San Calixto in Norte de Santander. He died after the attack. No group has yet claimed this event.

An alleged thief was attacked by a mob in Cartagena de Indias in Bolivar. The police had to intervene to protect the man who was injured with a knife and saved by the police. The man was remitted to the local clinic.

Groups of Venezuelan nationals demonstrated in the streets of Bogota to protest the possession of President Nicolas Maduro In Venezuela on January 10th. The group walked to the different consulates of the cities. No people were registered injured.
An unidentified armed group attacked the oil pipeline Cano Limon Covenas on January 10th. The damages caused by the explosion produced the spilled of several liters of petroleum.

Groups of Venezuelan nationals demonstrated in the streets of Barranquilla to protest the possession of President Nicolas Maduro In Venezuela on January 10th. The group walked to the different consulates of the cities. No people were registered injured.
On January 10, the abduction of a civilian by unidentified armed men in the municipality of Chimichagua in Cesar was reported. No armed group has yet claimed this event.

Groups of Venezuelan nationals demonstrated in the streets of Medellin to protest the possession of President Nicolas Maduro In Venezuela on January 10th. The group walked to the different consulates of the cities. No people were registered injured.

A group of civilians, some of them Venezuelan nationals, organized a peaceful protest in front of the consulate of Venezuela in Bucaramanga on January 10th. The event was to protest the new possession of mandate of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro.

Ecopetrol reported damages due to an attack (assumed with explosives) in the pipeline of Cano Limon-Covenas in the rural area of the municipality of Arauquita, Arauca on January 9th. Only materials damages were reported and no group has yet claimed this event.

The Colombian government Peace Commissioner declared, in a public meeting in the department of Arauca, that the ELN has to agree to a unilateral ceasefire in order to continue the negotiations in La Habana. The armed group emitted a public communication in which the rejected this condition.

As reported on January 11 2019, group of journalists was harassed by armed men in a motorcycle while they were reporting the targeting of social leaders in the town El Salado in Carmen de Bolivar in Bolivar.

The military forces of Colombia found and seized a deposit with several medical materials and other elements for medical aid that belonged to an illegal armed group. The deposit was located in the area Las Perlas of the municipality of Baraya, informed a local newspaper on January 10th.
An unidentified armed group attacked the oil pipeline Cano Limon Covenas on January 8th. The damages caused by the explosion resulted in the leaking of several liters of petroleum.
On January 7th the president of the JAC was killed in the municipality of Cartagena del Chaira in Caqueta.No armed group has claimed this event.

actor2: Police Forces of Colombia (2018-) ESMAD: Mobile Anti-Disturbance Squadron
notes: A group of rioters in the area of Bosa in Bogota had to be controlled by ESMAD police units on January 7th. The group was looting abandoned houses in the area El Porvenir. The event produced several damages. No people were reported injured.

As reported on January 7, 2019, at the Jorge Gaitan Duran bridge in Cucuta, Norte de Santander department, a civilian was killed by a police officer. The attack occurred when the victim was inside a taxi. The taxi driver did not stop while police officers were conducting a security operation. One fatality recorded.

source: Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz
notes: On January 7, 2019, in Cartagena del Chaira, Caqueta department, a social leader was killed by unidentified armed individuals. The motive of the attack is not reported. One fatality recorded.

A member of the Military Forces of Colombia was abducted in the rural area of the municipality Villa del Rosario in Norte de Santander on January 7th. The man was on leave when unidentified armed men forced him on a motorcycle and drove away. No group has yet claimed this event.

On January 7, 2019, at the Jorge Gaitan Duran bridge in Cucuta, Norte de Santander department, residents protested the attack perpetrated by a police officer against a teacher. The teacher was killed. Residents demand justice for the victim. [size=no report]

An official report of January 6th, claims that north or Cauca in a turf war between the EPL and the FARC dissident group Front 6th. According to the information, the areas of Toribio, Caloto, and Jambalo have registered movements of armed men by the Front 6th. Meanwhile, the EPL has expanded their occupation in the areas of Miranda and Corinto.

actor1: FARC Dissident - 6th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (6th Front)
notes: An official report of January 6th, 2019, claims that north or Cauca in a turf war between the EPL and the FARC dissident group Front 6th. According to the information, the areas of Toribio, Caloto, and Jambalo have registered movements of armed men by the Front 6th. Meanwhile, the EPL has expanded their occupation in the areas of Miranda and Corinto.

assoc_actor_2: JAC: Council of Communal Action; Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
notes: On 5 January 2019, a social leader and active member of JAC was killed by an unidentified armed group in the Puerto Jobo in the municipality of Zaragoza, Antioquia.

assoc_actor_2: JAC: Council of Communal Action; Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); Women (Colombia)
source: Front Line Defenders; ProtectDefenders.eu; El Espectador
notes: On January 5, 2019, in Bonda, Santa Marta, Magdalena, a female social leader and member of the victims' organizations was attacked near her house in the rural area of Bonda. No group has yet claimed this event. She died for the injuries in the morning of January 7th.
On 5 Jan 2019, a social leader of the Catatumbo region was killed by an unidentified armed group in the rural area of the Hacari in Norte de Santander.
On 5 January 2019, unidentified armed actors attacked (assumed with explosives) Cano Limon Covenas oil pipeline at Campo Giles (Tibu, Norte De Santander).
On 5 January 2019, a social leader and active member of the program for illegal crop restitution was killed by an unidentified armed group in the rural area of the Cajibio in Cauca.

On 4 January 2019, a human rights defender and, member of Marcha Patriotica, ATCC: Farmers Association of Cajibio, ANZORC: National Association for Farmer Reserve Areas and COCCAM: National Coordinator for Coca, Marijuana and Poppy Growers, was shot dead by 4 unidentified armed men in La Independencia, El Carmelo (Cajibio, Cauca).

On 4 January 2019, the president of Asojuntas and CISCA: Social Integration Committee of Catatumbo militant, was shot by unidentified armed actors in Hacari (Hacari, Norte De Santander) while leaving his residence. He survived the attack and was taken to hospital.

assoc_actor_2: JAC: Council of Communal Action; Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
source: Front Line Defenders; El Espectador; ProtectDefenders.eu
notes: On 4 January 2018, a social leader and member of the JAC was attacked by armed men in the urban area of the municipality of Hacari in Norte de Santander. The victim later died in a hospital. No group has claimed this event, but the area is controlled mostly by the ELN and EPL.

assoc_actor_2: JAC: Council of Communal Action; Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia)
source: Caracol Radio; ProtectDefenders.eu; Front Line Defenders
notes: On 4 January 2019, a community leader and president of the JAC of Vereda La Vera de Puerto Jobo was shot dead by unidentified armed actors in his house in La Vera de Puerto Jobo, Palizada (Zaragoza, Antioquia).
On 4 January 2018, in Cajibio, Cauca, a human rights activist from the peasants community was shot dead by unidentified armed men.

The son of a recognized social leader of Santander de Quilichao in Cauca disappeared on January 4th. The man left his house in the morning but he never returned. It is believed the event was perpetrated by armed groups that operated in this area.

On late 4 January 2019, inhabitants from Turbaco (Turbaco, Bolivar) took to the streets again to protest against the lack of potable water and demanding the restoration of the service. Inhabitants also marched in protest on 3 January 2019.

On 4 January 2019, garbage collectors from Public Companies of Armenia (EPA) staged a protest in Carrera 17 with Calle 27, in Armenia (Armenia, Quindio), against the dismissal, without reasons, of workers, and denying to start collecting garbage in the city.

On 4 January 2019, a leading member of the Clan del Golfo (AGC) was arrested in a Police operation in the municipality of Carepa in Antioquia. He was living in an apartment complex near the house of Medellin's major.

On 4 January 2019, prisoners at Villavicencio's prison (Villavicencio, Meta) beat and insulted Pastor Gomez Vaca, who raped and murdered a 12-year-old girl at a New Year's Eve party in Cabuyaro, Meta, on 31 December 2018.

On 3 January 2019, prisoners at Amalfi prison (Amalfi, Amalfi, Antioquia) torched the bathrooms and mattresses inside the prison, creating a fire and throwing objects, affecting neighbouring houses. No injuries were reported.

actor2: Police Forces of Colombia (2018-) Prison Guards
notes: On 3 January 2019, a riot erupted at the Immediate Reaction Unit in Kennedy (Bogota D.C., Bogota D.C.), after which 2 police officers resulted injured and 6 prisoners escaped (of which 3 have already been re-captured).

On late 3 January 2019, the community in La Arboleda neighbourhood, Manizales (Manizales, Caldas) caught, lightly beat and held a man -who was trying to mug a woman- until the Police Forces arrived and arrested him.

On 3 January 2019, inhabitants from Turbaco, Turbaco (Bolivar) staged a demonstration close to Troncal de Occidente road, blocking the roads and burning tires demanding the company in charge of the water administration to restore the water service immediately (as they have been without water in their houses for more than 2 months).

On 2 January 2019, inhabitants from Granada (San Luis De Since, Sucre) took to the streets to demand justice for the assassination of Robert Gamarra Robles, well-known driver in the municipality who was killed by unidentified individuals on 31 December 2018 on the road towards Granada (San Luis De Since, Sucre).

On late 2 January 2019, a well-known trader in Fortul (Fortul, Arauca), was shot dead by unidentified armed actors in his business premisses and house in El Centro neighbourhood, Fortul (Fortul, Arauca). Although the perpetrators are still unknown, the area has been suffering constant attacks by FARC dissidents, ELN fighters and other armed groups.

On 2 January 2019, inhabitants from Santa Fe neighbourhood, Comuna 5, Buenaventura (Buenaventura, Valle Del Cauca), blocked the internal road in the neighbourhood as well as Avenida Simon Bolivar to demonstrate against the lack of regular potable water in the sector and demand the restoration of the service.
On 2 January 2019, a 27-year-old was taken from his home and shot dead in Verde, Guayacana (San Andres De Tumaco, Narino) by unidentified armed men.

On 2 January 2019, inhabitants from El Pilon, Mojarras (Mercaderes, Cauca) blocked the international road to demonstrate against the lack of energy service in the sector, demanding the company in charge to improve the service.
On January 1, 2019, unidentified armed men killed a woman in the area Capitan Largo, municipality of Abrego, Norte de Santander. No group has yet claimed the attack.

assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Communal Group (Colombia); Afro-Colombian Ethnic Group (Colombia)
notes: On 1 January 2018, in Suarez, Cauca, a social leader and cultural activist from the afro-colombian community was killed by an unidentified armed group.

assoc_actor_2: Health Workers (Colombia); Police Forces of Colombia (2018-)
notes: On late 1 January 2019, relatives and friends of 2 injured youths that arrived to PIO X hospital in La Tebaida (La Tebaida, Quindio), one of which died as a result of injuries of unknown origin, vandalized the facilities and intimidated the medical professionals. The Police Forces had to intervene to disperse the mob.

source: Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz
notes: On January 1, 2019, in Cajibio, Cauca department, a social leader was killed by unidentified armed individuals. The motive of the attack is not reported. One fatality recorded.

On 1 January 2019, police officers from GAULA clashed with unidentified armed actors as the latter attacked them with firearms and torched their vehicle in Comuna 12, Buenaventura (Buenaventura, Valle Del Cauca).
